an6.76:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t realize perfection.
an6.76:1.3: Conceit, inferiority complex, superiority complex, overestimation, obstinacy, and groveling.
an6.76:1.4: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t realize perfection.
an6.76:2.1: After giving up six things you can realize perfection.
an6.76:2.3: Conceit, inferiority complex, superiority complex, overestimation, obstinacy, and groveling.
an6.76:2.4: After giving up these six things you can realize perfection.”
